VD_codebert module

class VD_codebert.InputFeatures(input_tokens, input_ids, idx, label)[source]

Bases: object

A single training/test feature for an example.

input_tokens

Tokenized input sequence.

Type:

list

input_ids

List of token IDs for the input sequence.

Type:

list

idx

The index of the example.

Type:

str

label

The label(s) for the example.

Type:

int or list

class VD_codebert.TextDataset(tokenizer, args, file_path=None, one_hot_vectors=[], suffixes=[])[source]

Bases: Dataset

Custom Dataset class for processing text data.

examples

List of processed examples in InputFeatures format.

Type:

list

VD_codebert.codebert_deploy(model_pre, config, tokenizer, args)[source]

Deploy the CodeBERT-based model in training mode with incremental learning.

Parameters:

  • model_pre (object) – Pre-trained model instance.

  • config (object) – Configuration of the model.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing text data.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

VD_codebert.codebert_train(model_pre, config, tokenizer, args)[source]

Train a CodeBERT-based model on a given dataset.

Parameters:

  • model_pre (object) – Pre-trained model instance.

  • config (object) – Configuration of the model.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing text data.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

VD_codebert.conformal_prediction(args, model, tokenizer)[source]

Apply conformal prediction to model predictions to quantify prediction uncertainty.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

  • model (object) – Trained model instance.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance used for data processing.

Returns:

  • dict – Results of conformal prediction, including metrics like accuracy and F1 score.

  • list – Indices of samples selected for incremental learning.

VD_codebert.cvconvert_examples_to_features(code_new, label, tokenizer, args)[source]

Convert code examples to model input features.

Parameters:

  • code_new (str) – New code to be tokenized and processed.

  • label (int) – The label for classification.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for tokenizing the code.

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing model configuration.

Returns:

Tokenized features with input tokens, input IDs, and label.

Return type:

InputFeatures

VD_codebert.deploy(args, train_dataset, model, tokenizer)[source]

Deploy the model in training mode with incremental accuracy updates.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset used for model training.

  • model (object) – Model to be deployed and trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing text data.

Returns:

Best incremental accuracy achieved.

Return type:

float

VD_codebert.epoch_test(args, model, tokenizer)[source]

Run an evaluation over multiple epochs using the test dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

  • model (object) – Model to be evaluated.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance used for data processing.

Returns:

Dictionary with evaluation metrics such as accuracy, recall, and F1 score.

Return type:

dict

VD_codebert.evaluate(args, model, tokenizer, eval_when_training=False)[source]

Evaluate the model’s performance on the evaluation dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

  • model (object) – Model to be evaluated.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing data.

  • eval_when_training (bool, optional) – Whether to evaluate during training.

Returns:

Dictionary with evaluation metrics such as accuracy and loss.

Return type:

dict

VD_codebert.evaluate_test(args, model, tokenizer, eval_when_training=False)[source]

Evaluate the model using the test dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing configuration details.

  • model (object) – Model to be evaluated.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing data.

  • eval_when_training (bool, optional) – Whether to evaluate during training.

Returns:

Dictionary containing test evaluation metrics such as accuracy and loss.

Return type:

dict

VD_codebert.incre(args, train_dataset, model, tokenizer)[source]

Train the model incrementally with additional dataset samples.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser containing model configuration.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset for training.

  • model (object) – Model to be trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for data processing.

Returns:

Best accuracy achieved during training.

Return type:

float

VD_codebert.model_initial()[source]

Initialize the model, tokenizer, and arguments.

Returns:

  • object – Initialized model object.

  • object – Configuration of the model.

  • object – Tokenizer instance for processing text data.

  • argparse.Namespace – Argument parser containing configuration details.

VD_codebert.onehot(file_path='', seed=123)[source]

Generate one-hot encoded labels based on file data.

Parameters:

  • file_path (str, optional) – Path to the data file for label extraction.

  • seed (int, optional) – Random seed for consistent encoding.

Returns:

One-hot encoded vectors and corresponding suffix labels.

Return type:

list, list

VD_codebert.remove_duplicates_and_preserve_order(arr)[source]

Remove duplicates from a list while preserving order.

Parameters:

arr (list) – List with potential duplicate values.

Returns:

List without duplicates, preserving the original order.

Return type:

list

VD_codebert.set_seed(seed=42)[source]

Set random seed for reproducibility.

Parameters:

seed (int) – Random seed value.

VD_codebert.train(args, train_dataset, model, tokenizer)[source]

Train the model on a specified dataset.

Parameters:

  • args (argparse.Namespace) – Argument parser with model configuration details.

  • train_dataset (TextDataset) – Dataset used for training the model.

  • model (object) – Model to be trained.

  • tokenizer (object) – Tokenizer instance for processing text data.

Returns:

Best F1 score achieved during training.

Return type:

float
